alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 10:22PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Near-record to record temperatures continue Sunday, causing continued quick snowmelt in the high terrain. Area streams and rivers, especially those sourced from the Wind River Range are rising and may rise further through early next week. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...River and stream flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...The Popo Agie and Little Wind River Drainages are the locations most likely to be affected, including locations around Lander to Riverton. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor river flooding is likely to occur in low-lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 959 PM MDT, River gauges currently report many sites rising to above Action Stage due to warm temperatures and snowmelt.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown if encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
